title: San Serif Headline
content:
The tip of the lower case a seems strange and may be the key here.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415104415im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sexual%20health%20coalition%20type_4623.jpg)
author: homeboy

comments.content: [Latin counter-part](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415104415/http:/typophile.com/node/101748#comment-548582) of some font for non-latin languages such as Oriya MN or Myanmar MN. It looks actually like chopped-off serif job on Times to me.

**Oriya MN** a Mac OS X Mountain Lion system font:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/103724](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415104415/http:/typophile.com/node/103724 "http://typophile.com/node/103724")

Thanks. Armed with a name I found this:  
 [http://www.legacyfitness.co.za/groups/Fonts/Oriya%20MN/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415104415/http:/www.legacyfitness.co.za/groups/Fonts/Oriya%20MN/ "http://www.legacyfitness.co.za/groups/Fonts/Oriya%20MN/")
